alert.note: Alert for Hendry (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hendry County through 945 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Montura, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clewiston, Montura, Devils Garden and Harlem. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
